Starting Monsters
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Monster Rancher DS: General QA: Starting Monsters
By Thorr on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 02:43 pm:

One thing I remember about this game from the first time around was that it was hard to get a good starting monster. After doing a number of drawings, I find it to still be true. I am using the best I could find - Flazer (Tiger/Abyss)

Anyone manage to get any good monsters out of the gate?

By VenomousX on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 03:15 pm:

I'm using a Flazer as well. Most of my monsters seem to be Pixies, moochis, suezos, bakus, lesiones, duckens, and that thing that hides in a pumpkin looking thing.

I haven't gotten anything too great, a few falcos, and golems. I'd like to spawn a Beaclon or naga but I'm not having much luck.

Also, I read on GameFaqs somewhere for the voice-regen type that is doesn't matter so much -what- you say, but the tone of voice you use and possibly the volume. That might be why I'm getting a lot of similar monsters, so I'll have to test that out.

By Thorr on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 03:29 pm:

You couldn't get a beaclon or Naga anyway. They need to be unlocked. See MFDS2 for details.

By VenomousX on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 07:07 pm:

Ahh.. Well I assumed that Naga was available from the beginning like in MR2. Also Beaclon doesn't have any info at all about unlocking him (looking at the japanese archive)

Also I assumed that I could still make them but wouldn't be able to take them home, like when you get a monster that's too big for your stable (E.G. golem. He was added to my encyclopedia but I couldn't bring him home)

Have no idea how to make a Modoki or how to use it to get other breeds, but if I run across one I'll try that :)

By Kitty Meow Meow on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 07:15 pm:

To make a Modoki, you can either randomly generate it at the shrine (I think?) or make a combination that doesn't exist. For example, I combined a Tiger and a Plant to make a Tiger/Plant monster, which became a Tiger-Modoki ("Tiger-ish", as it has been translated.)

Then, you take the Modoki/Ish monster, combine it with a monster with a main type of which you want a special (for example, I combined it with another Tiger so I could get Poochy (Tiger/?). Use the Modoki's sub-type and the other monster's main type and you should get a special. :)

By VenomousX on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 07:25 pm:

So if you mixed, for example, a "tiger-ish" (Madoki/tiger?) with a pure-breed "Golem" you'd get a special "golem/?"

I think?

Little confused lol.

By Kitty Meow Meow on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 07:28 pm:

I believe so, yes.

Sorry, I have trouble explaining things clearly sometimes, haha.

By VenomousX on Friday, August 6, 2010 - 08:26 pm:

Alright thanks :)

Also I can confirm the tone of voice is what matters. I said the word "blue" in different tones (from deep to high pitched) and got different monsters each time.

I think the length of the incantation might also play a role.

By Thorr on Saturday, August 7, 2010 - 05:47 pm:

I can create a master list of all monsters that can be made by voice and those that can be made by Drawing. Voice and Drawing have no particular specials in them. They are completely mathematical.

All set specials come from the Handwriting entry except for the Zodiac monsters. They have to be drawn with the pattern they give you.

Combining for Specials is something that I didn't do in the japanese game, so its news to me.

By Shen the Keeper on Sunday, August 8, 2010 - 01:53 pm:

When I tried the combine of course it listed it as a pure monster (pancho/pancho in this case). Just for fun I tried combining it anyways, and it had normal results. In this case another Modoki.
